author: Staff Reporter
text:
Civic groups construct concrete hall near Dhandeeswarar Temple

Velachery might have the finest malls and commercial complexes, but for a long time, residents here found it difficult to perform the last rites of their dear ones due to lack of a suitable place.

Most people performing the last rites did so under the canopy of a banyan tree near Dhandeeswarar Temple in Velachery, said activist S. Kumararaja. Deciding to create a suitable space for people to perform the last rites, civic groups came together and planned to construct a concrete hall with necessary amenities in a plot measuring 1,800 sq. ft. The land belongs to Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowment (HR and CE) Department.

The hall was constructed at a cost of Rs. 15 lakh through donations collected from residents and philanthropists. The small building was constructed without uprooting and or trimming the banyan tree, Mr. Kumararaja said. The hall is located on Velachery Main Road, near the office of Chennai Corporation’s 179th division.
title: A space for performing last rites in Velachery
